title: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor. However, it should display an error message indicating that the file cannot be opened in another editor while it is already open.
OB: When the Java Perspective is active, opening a java file by double-clicking on it in the workbench opens the file. Right-clicking on the same file and selecting 'Open With...System Editor' does nothing.
EB: When the Java Perspective is active, opening a java file by double-clicking on it in the workbench opens the file. However, if the same file is already open in another editor, right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With...System Editor' should display a warning message indicating that the file is already open in another editor and cannot be opened in a different editor.
SR:
1. Ensure that you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files. 
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a java file and select 'Open With...System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the java file. Close this window. 
3. In the Java Perspective, double-click on a java file to open it. The file will be opened in the workbench. 
4. Right-click on the same file and select 'Open With...System Editor'. It should display a warning message indicating that the file is already open in another editor and cannot be opened in a different editor.
